specificity_level_4.explanation: The Spring and Autumn Period in China occurred roughly from 771 to 476 BC, overlapping with the flourishing of Ancient Greece, particularly the early stages of its classical period. Similarly, the Tang Dynasty, which lasted from 618 to 907 AD, was contemporaneous with the Byzantine Empire, which was thriving during the same timeframe, particularly after the fall of the Western Roman Empire. Both pairs illustrate significant civilizations that existed at the same time in different parts of the world.

Similarly, The pair refers to another classic haiku by Matsuo Bashō: "古池や蛙飛び込む水の音" (An old pond; a frog jumps in—sound of water).
